meanings.definition: Feeling or showing concern or compassion for others.
meanings.sent1: She was sympathetic towards her friend who was feeling sad.
meanings.sent2: The nurse was sympathetic to the patient's pain.
meanings.sent3: The sympathetic teacher helped the student understand the difficult lesson.
meanings.sent4: His sympathetic smile reassured her during the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The sympathetic gesture of holding her hand comforted the grieving widow.

meanings.sent1: The two friends had a sympathetic bond that lasted for years.
meanings.sent2: Their sympathetic personalities made them great collaborators.
meanings.sent3: The sympathetic colors of the painting created a harmonious effect.
meanings.sent4: The music and lyrics were so sympathetic that it touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The sympathetic nature of the dog made it a beloved pet in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The audience was sympathetic to the performer's efforts on stage.
meanings.sent2: Her sympathetic nod indicated her agreement with the proposal.
meanings.sent3: The sympathetic crowd cheered loudly for the underdog team.
meanings.sent4: The sympathetic response from the community boosted his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The sympathetic comments from her colleagues motivated her to keep going.
